title-group.article-title: ASYMPTOTIC EXPANSIONS OF LEGENDRE SERIES COEFFICIENTS FOR FUNCTIONS WITH INTERIOR AND ENDPOINT SINGULARITIES

abstract.p: Let ${\mathrm{\Sigma }}_{\mathrm{n}=0}^{\infty }{\mathrm{e}}_{\mathrm{n}}\left[\mathrm{f}\right]{\mathrm{P}}_{\mathrm{n}}\left(\mathrm{x}\right)$ be the Legendre expansion of a function f(x) on (-1,1). In an earlier work [A. Sidi, Asymptot. Anal., 65 (2009), pp. 175—190], we derived asymptotic expansions as n → ∞ for e n [f], assuming that f ∈ C ∞ (-1,1), but may have arbitrary algebraic-logarithmic singularities at one or both endpoints x = ±1. In the present work, we extend this study to functions f(x) that are infinitely differentiable on [0,1], except at finitely many points x 1 ,...,x m in (-1,1) and possibly at one or both of the endpoints x 0 = 1 and x m+1 = -1, where they may have arbitrary algebraic singularities, including finite jump discontinuities. Specifically, we assume that, for each r, f(x) has asymptotic expansions of the form $\mathrm{f}\left(\mathrm{x}\right)\sim \underset{\mathrm{s}=0}{\overset{\infty }{\mathrm{\Sigma }}}{\mathrm{W}}_{\mathrm{r}\mathrm{s}}^{(\pm )}|\mathrm{x}-{\mathrm{x}}_{\mathrm{r}}{|}^{{\mathrm{\delta }}_{\mathrm{r}\mathrm{s}}^{(\pm )}}\mathrm{a}\mathrm{s}\mathrm{x}\to {\mathrm{x}}_{\mathrm{r}}\pm $ , where ${\mathrm{W}}_{\mathrm{r}\mathrm{s}}^{(\pm )}$ and ${\mathrm{\delta }}_{\mathrm{r}\mathrm{s}}^{(\pm )}$ are, in general, complex and $\Re {\mathrm{\delta }}_{\mathrm{r}\mathrm{s}}^{(\pm )}>-1$ . We derive the full asymptotic expansion of e n [f] as n → ∞ for this very general behavior of f(x). In the course of this study, we also derive a full asymptotic expansion as n → ∞ for integrals of the form ${\int }_{\mathrm{c}}^{\mathrm{d}}\mathrm{f}\left(\mathrm{x}\right){\mathrm{P}}_{\mathrm{n}}\left(\mathrm{x}\right)\mathrm{d}\mathrm{x}$ where [c,d] ∈ (-1,1) and f ∈ C ∞ [c,d] or f ∈ C ∞ (c,d) but may have arbitrary algebraic singularities at x = c and/or x = d.
